file_content.text: In striking at the servants of Ki Sazen, you have sealed your fate. I may die, but she will never be defeated!
What are you talking about? Why are you so devoted to a Jedi?
Who are you people?
I never wanted a fight. Talk to me about your master.
I'm not here to hurt you.
Ki Sazen saved my people. She was only a Padawan when she came to Tas-La and slew the Spine Dragon of M'dweshuu.
It was she who brought the Nikto to Taris. We swore our lives to her, and I will tell you nothing.
Idiot. [Strike]
Moderate your tone. You're in no position to insult anyone.
Idiot.
Ki Sazen saved our homeland. My life belongs to her.
You will become dust still ignorant of what happened.
You'll talk sooner or later. Improvised interrogations are my specialty.
You don't want to defy me.
For example... this is a bio-research lab, isn't it? What do you think would happen if I injected you with these chemicals?
You would not....
I think she might.
I bet he would.
We don't know what this place was built for....
That could kill him, sir.
Of course, I should probably test the dosage on your men first.
Enough! I will not--I will not allow that.
You and your people can return to serve Ki Sazen. But first, you must teach me what she taught you.
Let me help you.
Very well. In exchange for life and freedom, I will speak. But I will not betray her.
I don't have the patience for games. You are going to talk.
Enough of this. [Hurt him]
Agh. Ah!
I think he's convinced. Poor, brave guy.
We think that's enough, agent. Any more and you'll kill him.
I think I'm going to need some fresh air.
Enough. Please, enough.
We came to find the secrets of the Ultrawave Transmitter. A machine crafted by Nasan Godera.
Its signals are the song of the rakghouls. It controls their colonies. When it is ready, they will be her army.
You stole the transmitter, but you needed something more. Am I right?
And so you came here.
What's a Jedi going to do with a rakghoul army?
Ki Sazen wants rakghouls?
She will rule the stars. But not yet.
Your master is a lunatic. You do realize that?
I hope you know she's insane.
Her mind is not mine to know.
The Ultrawave Transmitter was never completed. That is our task--the three Chosen of Ki Sazen, each with our own mission.
I was to obtain rakghoul biological research from this, the laboratory of Doctor Dorant.
The Chosen Bo'kesh seeks data on colony movements. The Chosen Fhentar seeks a Republic scientist--Doctor Ianna Cel--to complete the device. They will triumph soon.
What about the Jedi? Tell us where to find her?
And Ki Sazen? Where is she?
And where's your master in all this?
I have told you of my brothers so they may meet you in battle. But I will tell you nothing more.
I appreciate your help. Don't take this personally.
Thank you. [Knock him out]
I suggest you leave Taris. Things are going to get ugly.
You can go free, now.
My loyalty is to Ki Sazen. My life debt is to Ki Sazen.
And yet you have acted honorably. I offer a token of my clan.
Look for your brothers on the other side.
You're useless. [Kill him]
Let's get out of here. Then maybe call for reinforcements.
We don't lack for enemies. Maybe it's time to contact friends.
I don't pretend to understand what this mission is about, sir. But if there are two more Nikto clans out there... we may need support.
Big one up ahead. Nice horns.
They're of one mind, like a swarm. But where is their queen?
With due respect, sir--do all your missions involve this much firepower?
You are not to be here. You are not welcome!
You must be Ki Sazen's henchmen.
You work for the Jedi?
You speak her name. But you are not worthy. Die!
Let's put our weapons down.
Tell it to me with a mouth full of blood.
You're doomed. [Attack]
Die in her name!
We live only for her.
